In an interview with ''[[The News-Gazette (Champaign-Urbana)|The News-Gazette]]'', Allison said his mother Melissa Glover gave him his first name because she wanted to give him “a unique name.”<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.news-gazette.com/sports/illini-sports/football/2014-10-10/qa-geronimo-allison.html |title=Q&A with Geronimo Allison |last=Asmussen |first=Bob |date=October 10, 2014 |publisher=''The News-Gazette'' |access-date=January 16, 2017}}</ref> He credits his mother with instilling his religious faith, which he expresses in post-game prayers with opponents and teammates at midfield.<ref name="MilJS">{{cite web |last1=Hendricks |first1=Martin |title=Allison thankful for opportunity |url=https://www.jsonline.com/story/sports/nfl/packers/2016/11/16/player-profile-allison-thankful-opportunity/93992946/ |website=Milwaukee Journal Sentinel |accessdate=October 4, 2018 |language=en}}</ref>
 
In an interview with ''[[The News-Gazette (Champaign-Urbana)|The News-Gazette]]'', Allison said his mother Melissa Glover gave him his first name because she wanted to give him “a unique name.”<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.news-gazette.com/sports/illini-sports/football/2014-10-10/qa-geronimo-allison.html |title=Q&A with Geronimo Allison |last=Asmussen |first=Bob |date=October 10, 2014 |publisher=''The News-Gazette'' |access-date=January 16, 2017}}</ref> He credits his mother with instilling his religious faith, which he expresses in post-game prayers with opponents and teammates at midfield.<ref name="MilJS">{{cite web |last1=Hendricks |first1=Martin |title=Allison thankful for opportunity |url=https://www.jsonline.com/story/sports/nfl/packers/2016/11/16/player-profile-allison-thankful-opportunity/93992946/ |website=Milwaukee Journal Sentinel |accessdate=October 4, 2018 |language=en}}</ref>
    −
Allison attended [[Spoto High School]] in [[Riverview, Florida]].<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.espn.com/blog/green-bay-packers/post/_/id/31726/nearly-a-never-was-rookie-receiver-geronimo-allison-catches-packers-eye |title=Nearly a 'never was,' rookie receiver Geronimo Allison catches Packers' eye |last=Wilde |first=Jason |date=August 4, 2016 |publisher=''ESPN'' |access-date=January 16, 2017}}</ref> He was academically ineligible his sophomore and junior years, but worked in private classes with the coach's wife Anne Caparaso to improve his grades and had a successful senior season.<ref name=MilJS /> It is a widely known urban legend in Riverview, Florida that the reason Allison didn't play football his sophomore or junior years was thanks to a young middle line backer from Wisconsin named Jim Bosovic. Legend has it that Allison was running a crossing route in his first high school game and was completely destroyed by a vicious (yet perfectly legal) hit by the highly regarded linebacker Bosovic. It is said that the injury to Allison only took 3 weeks to recover from, but the trauma of being so viciously destroyed by the hit took 2 years to mentally recover from. [[NFL.com|[2]]]
+

'''Geronimo John Allison''' (born January 18, 1994) is an [[American football]] [[wide receiver]] for the [[Green Bay Packers]] of the [[National Football League]] (NFL). He played [[college football]] at [[Illinois Fighting Illini football|Illinois]], and was signed by the Packers as an [[undrafted free agent]] in 2016.

==Early life==
In an interview with ''[[The News-Gazette (Champaign-Urbana)|The News-Gazette]]'', Allison said his mother Melissa Glover gave him his first name because she wanted to give him “a unique name.”<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.news-gazette.com/sports/illini-sports/football/2014-10-10/qa-geronimo-allison.html |title=Q&A with Geronimo Allison |last=Asmussen |first=Bob  |date=October 10, 2014 |publisher=''The News-Gazette'' |access-date=January 16, 2017}}</ref> He credits his mother with instilling his religious faith, which he expresses in post-game prayers with opponents and teammates at midfield.<ref name="MilJS">{{cite web |last1=Hendricks |first1=Martin |title=Allison thankful for opportunity |url=https://www.jsonline.com/story/sports/nfl/packers/2016/11/16/player-profile-allison-thankful-opportunity/93992946/ |website=Milwaukee Journal Sentinel |accessdate=October 4, 2018 |language=en}}</ref>

Allison attended [[Spoto High School]] in [[Riverview, Florida]].<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.espn.com/blog/green-bay-packers/post/_/id/31726/nearly-a-never-was-rookie-receiver-geronimo-allison-catches-packers-eye |title=Nearly a 'never was,' rookie receiver Geronimo Allison catches Packers' eye |last=Wilde |first=Jason |date=August 4, 2016 |publisher=''ESPN'' |access-date=January 16, 2017}}</ref> He was academically ineligible his sophomore and junior years, but worked in private classes with the coach's wife Anne Caparaso to improve his grades and had a successful senior season.<ref name=MilJS /> 

==College career==
Due to his academic struggles in high school, Allison began college at [[Iowa Western Community College]] in [[Council Bluffs, Iowa]]. He proved a bright student, finishing an associate's degree in just three semesters; he also led the team to a 22–1 record in two seasons, an NJCAA title, and led the conference in receptions, yards, and touchdowns his second year.<ref name=MilJS />

Allison transferred to the [[University of Illinois at Urbana–Champaign|University of Illinois]], where he played for the [[Illinois Fighting Illini football|Fighting Illini]] in 2014 and 2015.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://fightingillini.com/roster.aspx?rp_id=2171|title=Illinois Fighting Illini: Geronimo Allison|work=FightingIllini.com|accessdate=October 14, 2016}}</ref> His junior year, he was usually the second option to freshman star [[Mike Dudek]], though he caught five touchdowns to Dudek's six for the 6–7 Illini. In week 3, he had a career best 6 receptions for 160 yards and two touchdowns in a lopsided loss to [[2014 Washington Huskies football team|Washington]].<ref>{{cite web |title=Illinois at Washington Box Score, September 13, 2014 |url=https://www.sports-reference.com/cfb/boxscores/2014-09-13-washington.html |website=College Football at Sports-Reference.com |language=en}}</ref> Allison took over the top spot his senior year, replacing the injured Dudek for 882 yards but only three touchdowns during the [[2015 Illinois Fighting Illini football team|5–7 campaign]]. He had over 90 yards receiving in five of the first seven games, but five or fewer receptions in the final five games of the season.<ref name="colglog">{{cite web |title=Geronimo Allison Career Game Log |url=https://www.sports-reference.com/cfb/players/geronimo-allison-1/gamelog/ |website=College Football at Sports-Reference.com |language=en}}</ref> He was an All-Big Ten honorable mention, and won the team's Service Above Self award.<ref name=MilJS />

==Professional career==

After going undrafted in the [[2016 NFL Draft]], Allison signed with the [[Green Bay Packers]] on May 6, 2016.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170821212438/http://www.packers.com/news-and-events/article-press-release/article-1/packers-sign-19-rookie-free-agents/b9554146-c6a7-4362-b196-3878cbfe8295 |title=Packers sign 19 rookie free agents |date=May 6, 2016 |website=Packers.com |dead-url=yes |access-date=July 30, 2016}}</ref> On September 3, 2016, he was released by the Packers during final team cuts,<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180402184923/http://www.packers.com/news-and-events/article-roster-moves/article-1/packers-keep-six-undrafted-rookies-including-qb-joe-callahan/9e6d9856-8feb-4a8d-b038-90cfcff1b0b3 |title=Packers keep six undrafted rookies, including QB Joe Callahan |date=September 3, 2016 |website=Packers.com |access-date=September 3, 2016}}</ref> but re-signed to the Packers' [[practice squad]] two days later.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.packers.com/news-and-events/article-roster-moves/article-1/packers-sign-ls-goode-claim-rb-pressley/06e80998-be5a-42ad-82b9-2b48f8a4c893 |title=Packers sign LS Goode; claim RB Pressley |date=September 5, 2016 |website=Packers.com |dead-url=yes |access-date=October 4, 2016}}</ref> On October 24, 2016, he was promoted from the practice squad to the active roster.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.packers.com/news-and-events/article-roster-moves/article-1/packers-promote-wr-allison-s-whitehead-to-active-roster/921fd294-2012-4620-939f-5b6c7beb463a |title=Packers promote WR Allison, S Whitehead to active roster |date=October 24, 2016 |website=Packers.com |dead-url=yes |access-date=October 24, 2016}}</ref> Allison made his NFL debut against the [[Atlanta Falcons]] in Week 8. His first career NFL reception came as a four-yard touchdown from [[Aaron Rodgers]] in the second quarter.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.espn.com/blog/green-bay-packers/post/_/id/34647/encouraging-sign-aaron-rodgers-and-packers-offense-back-on-track|title=Encouraging sign: Aaron Rodgers, Packers' offense back on track|last=Demovsky|first=Rob|work=ESPN.com|date=October 31, 2016|accessdate=October 31, 2016}}</ref> Though he started the Packers' last two games, he ended the season with just 12 receptions.

On July 19, 2017, Allison was suspended for the first game of the 2017 season for violating the league's substance-abuse policy.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://profootballtalk.nbcsports.com/2017/07/19/geronimo-allison-suspended-for-first-game-of-regular-season/ |title=Geronimo Allison suspended for first game of regular season |last=Florio |first=Mike |date=July 19, 2017 |website=ProFootballTalk.NBCSports.com}}</ref> In week 3, he had career bests of 6 receptions and 122 yards against [[2018 Cincinnati Bengals season|Cincinnati]], and finished fourth among Packers receivers on the season with 23 receptions.<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.cbssports.com/fantasy/football/news/packers-geronimo-allison-drops-122-yards-on-bengals/ |title=Packers' Geronimo Allison: Drops 122 yards on Bengals |work=CBSSports.com |access-date=October 9, 2018 |language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.pro-football-reference.com/teams/gnb/2017.htm |title=2017 Green Bay Packers Statistics & Players |website=Pro-Football-Reference.com |language=en |access-date=October 9, 2018}}</ref>

Allison was re-signed by the Packers on March 14, 2018.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.packers.com/news-and-events/article-daily-news-story/article-1/negotiating-window-opens-today-for-pending-nfl-free-agents/d8742ef7-d15c-43be-9959-72d670a9f2b1|title=Negotiating window opens today for pending NFL free agents|last=Hodkiewicz|first=Wes|work=Packers.com|date=March 12, 2018|accessdate=May 26, 2018|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180519153727/http://www.packers.com/news-and-events/article-daily-news-story/article-1/negotiating-window-opens-today-for-pending-nfl-free-agents/d8742ef7-d15c-43be-9959-72d670a9f2b1|archivedate=May 19, 2018}}</ref> He started the season well, with 19 receptions for 289 yards and two touchdowns before suffering a concussion in Week 4.<ref>{{Cite news |url=http://www.superiortelegram.com/sports/football/4503431-peterson-redskins-stomp-sloppy-packers-31-14 |title=Peterson, Redskins stomp sloppy Packers, 31–14 |work=Superior Telegram |access-date=October 9, 2018 |language=en}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |title=Packers' Geronimo Allison: Enters concussion protocol |url=https://www.cbssports.com/fantasy/football/news/packers-geronimo-allison-enters-concussion-protocol/ |website=CBSSports.com |language=en}}</ref> Allison was placed on injured reserve on November 6, 2018 after undergoing groin surgery.<ref>{{cite web |last1=Bouda |first1=Nate |title=Packers Place WR Geronimo Allison on IR, Waive S Jermaine Whitehead |url=http://nfltraderumors.co/packers-place-wr-geronino-allison-on-ir-waive-s-jermaine-whitehead/ |website=NFLTradeRumors.co |accessdate=November 6, 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Packers place WR Geronimo Allison on IR, release S Whitehead|url=https://www.packers.com/news/packers-place-wr-geronimo-allison-on-ir-release-s-whitehead|website=Packers.com|date=November 6, 2018}}</ref>
